name: carbon fibre reinforced plastic, injection moulded | carbon fibre reinforced plastic, injection moulded | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19912/documentation

The dataset represents the production of one kilogram of carbon fibre reinforced plastic for use in aircraft manufacture. The data is based on information presented as part of the supplementary information of Cox et al. (2018).;Carbon fibre reinforced plastic (CFRP) is a structural material formed from extremely thin carbon fibres in a polymeric matrix. The composite has high tensile strength, low thermal expansion and a very high strength-to-weight ratio. These properties have made it an important structural material in the aircraft manufacturing industry (Uhlmann et al., 2014; Pramanik et al., 2017).;The material and energy required for the production of carbon fibres is considered, along with the waste and environmental emissions released by this process. Transformation of these fibres into carbon fibre reinforced plastics, as used in aircraft manufacture are then considered (Cox et al., 2018).;This activity was created as an input for the aircraft production activities. ; Reference:                                                                               Cox, B., Jemiolo, W. & Mutel, C. (2018) Life cycle assessment of air transport and the Swiss commercial air transport fleet.  Transport Research Part D. 58. 1-13                                 Uhlmann, E., Sammler, F., Richarz, S., Heitmuller, F. & Bilz, M. (2014) Machining of Carbon Fibre Reinforced Plastics. New Production Technologies in the Aerospace Industry - 5th Machining Innovations Conference (MIC 2014). Procedia CIRP 24. 19-24                                                                          Pramanik, A., Basak, A., Dong, Y., Sarker, P., Uddin, M., Littlefair, G., Dixit, A. & Chattopadhyaya, S. (2017) Joining of carbon fibre reinforced polymer (CFRP) composites and aluminium alloys - A review. Composites Part A: Applied Science and Manufacturing. 101. 1-29  

Carbon fibre production, starting with receiving the materials required for production, and the subsequent injection moulding to form carbon fibre reinforced plastic.

The inventory includes the production of carbon fibres and their conversion into carbon fibre reinforced plastic. Environmental emissions and waste production in the carbon fibre manufacturing process are considered, along with injection moulding and the plastic polymer input.
category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from one life-cycle analysis on Swiss commercial aircraft fleet (Cox et al., 2018).;Carbon fibre reinforced plastic data presented for Europe in life-cycle analysis.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data based on life-cycle data presented in 2018 using 2015 representative aircraft parameters.;Activity used as input for 2016 aircraft production activity.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering Europe. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data is taken from a journal article presenting carbon fibre reinforced plastic life-cycle data for Europe.

exchanges.description: Waste from the production of carbon fibre based on LCA study by Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel (2018).                                                                          Cox, Jemiolo & Mutel (2018) and referenced LCA papers do not discuss why "waste asphalt" is included as an exhange in their carbon fibre LCA.  However, from other studies it can be seen that a large percentage of carbon fibre is wasted during manufacturing activities due to the layering and cutting nature of the process (Saburow et al., 2017; Schmidt & Watson, 2013). It is assumed that "waste asphalt" is used as a proxy for this carbon fibre waste.                                                                                           References: Schmidt, J. & Watson, J. (2013) Eco Island Ferry - Comparitice LCA of island ferry with carbon fibre composite based and steel based structures. 2-0 LCA consultants. Aalborg, Denmark.              Saburow, O., Huether, J., Maertens, R., Trauth, A., Kechaou, Y., Henning, F. & Weidenmann, K (2017) A Direct Process to Reuse Dry Fibre Production Waste for Recycled Carbon Fibre Bulk Molding Compounds. Procedia CIRP. 66. 265-270.
